verses.text: 懲罰摩押「耶和華這樣說：『摩押三番四次犯罪，我必不收回懲罰他的命令；因為他把以東王的骸骨焚燒成灰。

words.note: Here used as a noun in the title.
Here used as a verb modifying 'command'.

verses.text: 我必降火在摩押，燒毀加略的堡壘；在擾攘、吶喊、吹角聲中，摩押必被消滅。
我必剪除他的掌權者，也把他所有的領袖一同殺死。』這是耶和華說的。
懲罰猶大「耶和華這樣說：『猶大三番四次犯罪，我必不收回懲罰他的命令；因為他棄絕耶和華的律法，不遵守他的典章；反被他們列祖跟從的偶像，使他們走錯了路。

words.note: Here used as a noun in the title.
Here used as a verb modifying 'command'.
An idiom meaning 'to be misled'.

verses.text: 我必降火在猶大，燒毀耶路撒冷的堡壘。』
懲罰以色列「耶和華這樣說：『以色列三番四次犯罪，我必不收回懲罰他的命令；因為他為了銀子賣義人，為了一雙鞋賣窮人。

words.note: Verb-object compound referring to committing sin.
Often refers to God's commands in biblical contexts.
Common word that takes on specific social justice importance in biblical texts.

verses.text: 他們踐踏窮人的頭，好像踐踏地面的塵土；他們把困苦人應有的權益奪去；兒子和父親與同一個女子親近，故意褻瀆我的聖名。

words.definition: be intimate with, have sexual relations
words.note: Contextually refers to sexual relations.
Refers specifically to God's holy name.

verses.text: 他們在各祭壇旁，躺臥在別人抵押的衣服上面；在他們 神的殿中，飲用拿剝削回來的錢所買的酒。

words.note: The preceding blank character is a reverence mark, not a segmentable word.
Introduces a passive or resultive clause.

verses.text: 我不是在他們面前把亞摩利人消滅了嗎？亞摩利人雖像香柏樹高大，像橡樹那樣堅固；我卻要滅絕它樹上的果子，拔除樹下的根。

words.note: The cedar of Lebanon is a prominent tree in the Bible.

verses.text: 我不是帶你們出埃及地，領你們在曠野度過四十年，叫你們得著亞摩利人的地為業嗎？

words.note: A significant geographical and thematic location in the Bible.
Often implies receiving a blessing or promise in scripture.
Refers to the promised land or territory.
Often refers to inherited land or covenantal promises in biblical texts.

verses.text: 我從你們子孫中興起先知，從年輕人中興起拿細耳人；以色列人哪！這不是事實嗎？』這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: A group of people consecrated to God with a special vow.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 『但你們迫使拿細耳人喝酒，吩咐先知說：不要說預言。

words.note: Verb-object compound acting as a single verb.
Used to express prohibition or refusal.

verses.text: 看哪！我要使你腳下的地搖蕩，好像滿載禾捆的車子搖蕩一樣。

words.note: An exclamation used to draw attention.
捆 (kǔn/hùn) means 'bundle' or 'sheaf' here.

verses.text: 行動迅速的不能逃走，強而有力的不能施展他的勇力，勇士也不能救自己；

words.note: Turns preceding phrase into a noun, meaning 'the one who is swift in action'.
An idiom meaning 'strong and vigorous'.
Turns preceding phrase into a noun, meaning 'the strong and powerful one'.

verses.text: 拿弓的人站立不住，跑得快的不能逃走，騎馬的也不能救自己。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase meaning 'the one who holds a bow'.
Resultative complement indicating inability to maintain the verb's state.
Connects a verb with its adverbial complement.
Forms a nominal phrase meaning 'the one who runs fast'.
Verb-object compound acting as a single verb.
Forms a nominal phrase meaning 'the one who rides a horse'.

verses.text: 到那日，最勇敢的戰士，也是赤身逃跑。』這是耶和華的宣告。」

words.note: Often used in biblical context for nakedness or poverty.
The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, transliterated.
